p: Ochiai and co-workers [ 14, 15, 68, 82] studied coffee and alcoholic beverages, such as beer, wine and whiskey, applying GC×GC and a selectable one-/two-D system. Detection of substances in very low levels (ng and pg) were achieved in the analysis of all samples with the selectable 1D/ 2D system coupled with element specific and chemiluminescence detectors. The aroma profile of beer was obtained by Stefanto et al. [ 82], using GC×GC-TOFMS and multiple statistical analysis to assess the most representative flavour compounds.
